title: Directory traversal at https://nightly.ubnt.com
content:
From within the http request function of the Acunetix and IronWasp programs I was able to view the passwd and hosts files at https://nightly.ubnt.com.
Please see the attached screenshots for proof.
I have tried to reproduce from within firefox and internet explorer without much luck however if you need it I will try to come up with a work around.
For reference the response header is as follows:
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Date: Thu, 18 May 2017 13:35:08 GMT
Content-Type: application/octet-stream
Content-Length: 1339
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: Express
Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=15552000; includeSubDomains
Last-Modified: Wed, 25 May 2016 20:30:37 GMT
steps: Use a vulnerability scanning tool like Acunetix or IronWasp to send a crafted HTTP request to https://nightly.ubnt.com.
Access sensitive system files such as /etc/passwd or /etc/hosts through the directory traversal vulnerability.
vuln_description: Directory traversal vulnerability at https://nightly.ubnt.com allows unauthorized access to sensitive system files like /etc/passwd and /etc/hosts via crafted HTTP requests.
reason: The vulnerability was discovered using automated tools (Acunetix/IronWasp) and does not require complex interactions or novel logic. The attack is straightforward once the vulnerable endpoint is identified.
